Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk selinux-policy
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: Selinux-policy bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated selinux-policy packages that fix several bugs are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.3 The selinux-policy packages contain the rules that govern how confined processes run on the system.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* Previously, SELinux policy targeted warnings and errors appeared when updating from Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 to 7.3. This bug has been fixed by executing the policy migration script in the %postinstall phase only if the semanage utility exists on the system. As a result, the update proceeds without the errors or warnings. (BZ #1393045)
* Previously, when the Ganesha NFS was configured, SELinux Access Vector Cache (AVC) messages appeared in the audit.log file. Consequently,the AVC messages blocked communication between the cluster_t and fprintd_t domains through the DBus message system. This bug has been fixed by allowing the communication between the cluster_t and fprintd_t domains in the SELinux policy. As a result, the cluster_t and fprintd_t domains now communicate through the DBus message system as expected. (BZ #1393494)
* During the update from Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 to 7.3, when updating the systemd package and then the selinux-policy package in two independent updates, systemd generated USER_AVC messages and returned "Access Denied" errors to DBus clients, because SELinux prevented systemd from accessing DBus.To fix this bug, systemd is restarted after updating the SELinux policy package, during update from Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.2 to 7.3. As a result, systemd now does not generate AVC denials. (BZ #1394715)
Users of selinux-policy are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
